articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets South African President
Damage by Explosion at Ryongchon Railway Station
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets South African President 
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Thabo Mbuyelwa Mbeki on April 24 upon his reelection as president of the Republic of South Africa.
 The message said it was a manifestation of the South African people's deep trust in and expectation on him that he assumed again the heavy duty of presidency.    
 It wished the president greater successes in his responsible work for peace and stability, progress and prosperity of the country and expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow in scope and develop.

articles.title: First Installment of Emergency Relief Goods from China Arrives
Wreaths Laid in Patriotic Martyrs' Cemetery
articles.content:
First Installment of Emergency Relief Goods from China Arrives 
    Sinuiju, April 25 (KCNA) -- The first installment of emergency relief goods including food worth 500,000 Renminbi Yuan reached the spot on Sunday. This is part of the relief goods worth 10 million Renminbi Yuan to be donated by the Chinese government to the DPRK in connection with the explosion that occurred at Ryongchon Railway Station, North Phyongan Province.
 Gu Jinsheng, economic and trade counsellor of the Chinese embassy in Pyongyang, handed them over to Vice-Chairman of the North Phyongan Provincial People's Committee Choe Rin Se.

Greetings to President of Sierra Leone
articles.content:
Annual Meeting of Sweden-Korea Friendship Association Held
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association was held in Stockholm on April 17.
 The meeting summed up the work of the association and its executive members last year and discussed a working plan for this year.    
 It elected the executive committee of the association.

articles.title: Seventh Pyongyang International Trade Fair to Be Held
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Sierra Leone
    Pyongyang, April 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Al Haji Ahmed Tejan Kabbah, president of the Republic of Sierra Leone, on April 26 on the occasion of the 43rd anniversary of its independence.
 Wholeheartedly wishing him greater success in his responsible work for the peace, stability and social and economic development of the country, the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and develop.
